item.title: Cultures Portal
item.description: 2nd Realm Central Continent Morelland Proto-Morellic Modern Morellic Sarvara Sarvaran Sarvaran Poetry Empire of the Petrified Child Stonechild-imperial Snixia Proto-Snixian

item.title: Empire of the Petrified Child
item.description: Culture Stonechild Imperial culture was heavily influenced by the mythology surrounding the Petrified Child (Stonechild Imperial: Äryýsh, from Proto-Morellic *Asteihar) Thus, religion was a big factor in the workings of society.

item.title: Morellic Culture
item.description: The Proto-Morellic culture existed at around 7,000YA. The culture began as the two tribes, Rhohita and Cervina, met. Language Proto-morellic was the language spoken by the proto-morellic culture.

item.title: Neth River Civilisation
item.description: The Neth River Civilisation existed in 7,000 YA. Location The NRC (Neth River Civilisation) was located along the Neth River, which flowed from the Nessaui lake into the Sarvaran Gulf.

item.title: Sarvara
item.description: The Sarvaran Civilisation existed around 7,000YA, and spoke Sarvaran. Notable People Hastini the Elephant Hastini the Elephant Sarvaran: Hestį́da /xesˈtĩ́.da/ was a Sarvaran general who was known to wear a copper elephant mask over his mouth.

item.title: Sarvaran Music
item.description: Instruments The Rainslug The Rainslug (Sarvaran: Oveýsllea /ɔˈʋéý̯s.ɬea̯/) was originally a children’s toy made of many hollow hemispheres linked by ball-and-socket joints, taking an appearance reminiscent of a slug.

item.title: Tail Removal
item.description: Tail Removal was a highly humiliating procedure, as tails were seen as tangible links to the sacred squirrel ancestry of Minikin and removing them would be seen as desecrating the body.

item.title: The Petrified Child
item.description: Appearance The petrified child appears throughout the majority of history as a floating bean-shape with a face inset into the top half.
